definition: title of respect for the queen mother or the emperor's father/nickname for Empress Dowager Cixi 慈禧太后[Ci2 xi3 tai4 hou4]

prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough

sentences.english: And she was taking me shopping to Galeries Lafayette .
sentences.chinese: 那一次，她还带我去老佛爷百货公司购物。

sentences.english: Shopping malls, like Lafayette and Printemps, were much more crowed than what I expect.
sentences.chinese: 老佛爷，巴黎春天等购物中心的人流超过我的预料。

definition: Empress Dowager Cixi or Ts'u Hsi (reigned 1861-1908)
Empress Dowager Cixi or Ts'u Hsi (1835-1908), regent 1861-1908
the emperor/Your majesty the emperor/His imperial majesty
lit. to govern from behind the curtain/to rule in place of the emperor (idiom)
child emperor/(fig.) spoiled child/spoiled boy/pampered only child
